data.title: Not bad. Stick to wings
data.text: Reading the other reviews pays off. Ordered the honey BBQ and something from their secret menu called Arlene. Some kind of semi-spicy lemon sauce that was created by an employee Wayback when. that one is very recommended. Also, the pulled pork french fries are pretty interesting. The french fries and the pulled pork are deep-fried. It leaves the pulled pork a little on the dry side but, they mix it with their coleslaw and it comes out a little wetter and interesting. The service is a little on the slow side but, they tried to be as accommodating as possible and they are quite friendly. Ultimately, I recommend you stay to the hot wings menu. It appears that the rest of the menu, according to other reviews is nominal at best. Additionally,The oil they use for deep frying it is peanut oil. The hot wings are not dipped in flour.

data.title: Wy more than just wings!
data.text: I was in town for business and decided to wander away from the beach to avoid the touristy chain places. So glad I did. For a place named hot wings the menu is actually really diverse. I saw lots of people who order the pizza. Several salads around as well. Super friendly and attentive staff. I figured I should get wings after all the waitress recommended a sauce that is not even on the menu. I forget what it was called but ask for the house specialty sauce. Sort of a cross between buffalo medium and lemon pepper. How many places have baked brussel sprouts as a side. They were great too. Not cheap but certainly less expensive than other paces in the area. Would definitely go back here!

data.title: Wow!
data.text: The fries...omg. Deliciously seasoned to perfection. My boyfriend loved them too. They also have delicious fettuccine alfredo which I also enjoyed. Our waiter (who's name I forgot) was the kindest and most helpful. I'd definitely visit again!

data.title: Definitely would go back here!
data.text: From the outside it does not look like much of a resturant but it offers an excellent dining experience. It is nothing fancy but it is comfortable and homey. You feel like you are in a neighborhood restaurant where you could easily be a regular. The waitresses were all very pleasant and friendly.  There was a nice variety on the menu and the food was plentiful and delicious!  The cost was reasonably too.

data.title: Those wings!
data.text: Our daughters loved the wings so we went back day two for more, cute decor too, and boy the triple chocolate cake was indulgent but a good end

data.title: I want to go back!
data.text:
Alondra's never disappoints!  I was hooked from my very first experience about a year ago.  The staff is awesome, I've never had a bad experience with the service here.  The wings are amazing and the pizzas are definitely top notch.  I'm drooling just thinking about it, I want to go back!

You might have to wait a while for a table or booth but just be patient and wait, it's totally worth it!

data.title: Great for a good meal!
data.text: We wandered into Alondra while walking downtown LB. The atmosphere was welcoming and lively so we decided to give it a try. We ordered a variety of appetizers and meals and overall everything was very good. My veggie burger wasn't the best I've had, however I am picky so I can't say that it was the cook's fault. My husband had wings and salad and said they were the best he's had in a long time. The place was packed and everyone seemed to be enjoying their meal. The owner came out to ask about my meal after the waitress informed him I barely touched it. He was extremely gracious and offered to take it off our bill, but also wanted to know what I particularly didn't like. He genuinely cared for feedback. We chatted for a while and he was a super nice guy. This is a very well operated, efficient restaurant. It was family friendly and had plenty of sports on the TVs to watch. The location is great and staff are extremely nice and accommodating. Service was outstanding - we highly recommend!

data.title: Middle Eastern Food at its best
data.text:
The best Middle Eastern food this side of Armenia.  Try the grape leaves YUMMOOO.  The hummus is slightly different from its Greek version. More flavor and punch to it.  Prices are reasonable. The wine is very good and nicely priced.     Restaurant is located upstairs and has a nice outside patio overlooking Pine Ave. Nice place to have some wine, hummus and watch the world go by.  

 Hokuka (not sure of the spelling) is available.

Reasonable prices, Great food. Located upstairs from the AMC box office.

data.title: Top!!
data.text: Veramente un ottimo posto dove mangiare giganteschi panini oppure fantastiche alette di pollo!! Portatevi dietro la fame perché le porzioni sono a dir poco esagerate!! Prezzi nella media locale e ottime birre alla spina!! ENJOY!!
